channel.title: Bloomberg Technology

item.title: Salesforce Raises Annual Sales Outlook, Suggesting AI Payoff
item.description: Salesforce Inc. raised its annual sales forecast, suggesting that its AI agent product is on a path to contribute significant revenue.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: Marc Benioff, chief executive officer of Salesforce Inc., speaks during a keynote at the 2024 Dreamforce conference in San Francisco, California, US, on Tuesday, Sept. 17, 2024. Salesforce is unveiling a pivot in its artificial intelligence strategy this week at its annual Dreamforce conference, now saying that its AI tools can handle tasks without human supervision and changing the way it charges for software.

item.title: Apple to Rebrand Its Device Operating Systems to Mark Major Overhaul
item.description: Apple Inc. is planning the most sweeping change yet to its operating system names, part of a software overhaul that extends to all its devices.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: Apple’s iOS 18 introduction at WWDC 2024.

item.title: US Tightens China Chip Curbs by Targeting Design Software
item.description: The Trump administration is moving to restrict the sale of chip design software to China, people familiar with the matter said, as the US government evaluates a broader policy announcement on the issue.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Leonard, Mackenzie Hawkins

media:content.media:description: Researchers refine a semiconductor design.

item.title: Nvidia Gives Solid Forecast, Even as China Slump Mars Growth
item.description: Nvidia Corp., the world’s most valuable chipmaker, gave an upbeat revenue forecast for the current period, even as a slowdown in China weighed on results.
item.dc:creator: Ian King

media:content.media:description: Jensen Huang, co-founder and chief executive officer of Nvidia Corp., during the Computex conference in Taipei, Taiwan, on Tuesday, May 20, 2025. Computex kicked off Monday in Taipei, and as in years past will draw industry chieftains from and Huang Qualcomm Inc.'s Cristiano Amon to Young Liu of Foxconn, which makes the bulk of the world's iPhones and Nvidia servers.

item.title: This $7,000 Single-Seat Electric Car Has Become a Hit in Japan
item.description: In the rural suburbs of Hiroshima, a Japanese startup is trying to kick start the nation’s electric vehicle market with the smallest, cheapest car it can possibly make.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Takahashi

media:content.media:description: KG Motors CEO Kazunari Kusunoki with the mibot.

item.title: HP Plunges After Cutting Profit Outlook on Tariffs, Economy
item.description: HP Inc. dropped about 15% in extended trading after the company’s profit outlook fell short of estimates and it cut the annual earnings forecast, pointing toward a weaker economy and continuing costs from US tariffs on goods from China.
item.dc:creator: Dina Bass

media:content.media:description: Enrique Lores, president and chief executive officer of HP Inc., during the Computex conference in Taipei, Taiwan, on Monday, June 3, 2024. The trade show runs through June 7.

item.title: Nvidia Earnings Ahead, SpaceX Faces Another Setback | Bloomberg Technology 5/28/2025
item.description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss what investors are expecting from Nvidia’s earnings, which are set to be released after markets close on Wednesday. Plus, SpaceX’s Starship test flight ends in a fiery setback for the Elon Musk-led company. And, Okta CEO Todd McKinnon says his company offers better value than “legacy” tech competitors. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Victoria’s Secret Security Incident Disrupts Website, Email
item.description: Victoria’s Secret & Co. has stopped some office operations and told employees to avoid using company technology amid a “security incident” that also disrupted the retailer’s online shopping website and some store services.
item.dc:creator: Lara Sanli, Jeff Stone, Lily Meier

media:content.media:description: Pedestrians walk past a Victoria's Secret Stores LLC store in the Xidan shopping area in Beijing, China, on Wednesday, July 15, 2020. The Chinese economy returned to growth in the second quarter, marking an important milestone in the global struggle to recover from the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Buyout Firm Vista Nears $2 Billion Deal for Software Maker Acumatica
item.description: Vista Equity Partners is in advanced talks to acquire Acumatica Inc., a software company that helps businesses streamline workflow, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Gould, Swetha Gopinath

media:content.media:description: High angle view of a businessman using laptop in a restaurant Photographer: FG Trade/E+

item.title: Mercado Pago Will Apply for Argentina Banking License
item.description: Mercado Pago, the digital wallet and financial services arm of MercadoLibre, will request a banking license from Argentina’s central bank as part of its effort to expand its ecosystem, according to a statement Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Ignacio Olivera Doll, Maria Clara Cobo

media:content.media:description: Mercado Pago app

item.title: Nvidia CEO Huang Says China AI to Move On With or Without US Chips

media:content.media:description: Jensen Huang displays a Blackwell chip during an event in Taipei, Taiwan.

item.title: Fiber Firm Everstream Files Bankruptcy After Debt Struggles
item.description: Fiber-network provider Everstream has filed for bankruptcy in Texas after struggling with its debt load and underperforming rivals.
item.dc:creator: Dorothy Ma

media:content.media:description: Fiber optic cables.

item.title: Nvidia to Have Final Say on Strong Earnings Season for Big Tech
item.description: Nvidia Corp. faces the final test of an earnings season-driven rally that has sent its shares up about 45% from an April low.
item.dc:creator: Jeran Wittenstein, Ryan Vlastelica

item.title: Israel Acknowledges Use of Laser Weapons to Intercept Drones
item.description: Israel has deployed laser weapons during its ongoing war to deflect “scores” of aerial attacks, including from drones, the Defense Ministry said in a statement on Wednesday. This is the first time the country has acknowledged the use of directed-energy technologies in the battlefield.
item.dc:creator: Marissa Newman

media:content.media:description: An Israeli armored personnel carrier near the Gaza border after military operations, in southern Israel, on Wednesday, April 17, 2024. Iran’s unprecedented attack on Saturday night, lasting no more than several hours, came with a steep price tag, and points to the sheer expense of air anti-missile as nations such as Iran improve their drone and missile capabilities. Photographer: Kobi Wolf/Bloomberg

item.title: Anthropic Appoints Netflix Co-Founder Reed Hastings to Board
item.description: Board seeks to balance AI’s business interests, responsibilities to society
item.dc:creator: Shirin Ghaffary

media:content.media:description: Reed Hastings, co-founder and chief executive officer of Netflix Inc., during the Milken Institute Global Conference in Beverly Hills, California, U.S., on Monday, Oct. 18, 2021. The event convenes the best minds in the world to tackle its most urgent challenges and to help realize its most exciting opportunities.

item.title: Andreessen Horowitz-Backed Startup Is Trying to Build a Safer VPN
item.dc:creator: Gian Volpicelli

media:content.media:description: The aftermath of a Russian drone strike in Kyiv in March.

item.title: India Asks E-Commerce Firms to Stop Deceptive Shopping Practices
item.description: India’s government asked e-commerce platforms and retailers to remove so-called ‘dark patterns’ or deceptive actions that manipulate customers into making unintended purchases.
item.dc:creator: Preeti Soni, Satviki Sanjay

media:content.media:description: An employee scans a QR code while preparing a package for shipping at an e-commerce fulfillment center in Hyderabad, India.

item.title: UK Sees Card Fraud Soar Even After Clampdown on Payment Scams
item.description: Fraudsters have switched up their tactics after the UK cracked down on authorized push payment scams, meaning the overall amount stolen was broadly unchanged last year.
item.dc:creator: Meg Short

item.title: ASML Urges Consistency on Taxes After Dutch Government U-Turn
item.description: ASML Holding NV called on the Dutch government to ensure stable investment and fiscal policy, criticizing tax policy decisions that reduced benefits for foreign workers.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Van Oosterom, Charlotte Hughes-Morgan

media:content.media:description: Construction work at the ASML Holding NV headquarters in Veldhoven, Netherlands.

item.title: Czechs Blame China for Cyberattack Against Foreign Ministry
item.description: State-linked Chinese hackers were behind a cyberattack against the Czech Foreign Ministry’s unclassified networks, according to the government in Prague.
item.dc:creator: Krystof Chamonikolas, Andrea Dudik

media:content.media:description: Czech Foreign Minister Jan Lipavsky

item.title: Levittown: Parents Grapple With AI’s Meaning for Daughters, Sons
item.description: In the seventh episode of the Levittown podcast, a mother helps her daughter advocate for an anti-deepfake law — and another discovers her son is harassing women from his bedroom.
item.dc:creator: Olivia Carville, Margi Murphy

item.title: SpaceX Starship Rocket Explodes in Mid-Flight
item.description: Elon Musk's SpaceX suffers another setback. The Starship took off from Texas on Tuesday and exploded in mid-flight. The massive rocket leaked propellant and spun out of control. It's the third setback in a row for the program. But Musk celebrated the flight's achievements and said there will now be a faster launch cadence. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: DeepSeek Unveils Update to R1 Model
item.description: DeepSeek said it has upgraded the R1 artificial-intelligence model that helped propel the Chinese startup to global prominence earlier this year.
item.dc:creator: Luz Ding

media:content.media:description: Liang in January. Source: ZUMA Press

item.title: Telegram to Distribute Grok in $300 Million xAI Deal, CEO Durov Says
item.description: Telegram agreed to a one-year deal with Elon Musk’s xAI to distribute its Grok chatbot to the messaging platform’s billion-plus users, according to Chief Executive Officer Pavel Durov.
item.dc:creator: Jake Rudnitsky

item.title: Instacart Promotes Business Chief Rogers to CEO as Simo Leaves for OpenAI
item.description: Instacart promoted Chief Business Officer Chris Rogers to chief executive officer, replacing Fidji Simo who said earlier this month that she’s leaving for a top leadership position at OpenAI.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Lung, Dana Wollman

item.title: China’s Honor Developing Humanoid Robots in $10 Billion AI Plan
item.description: Honor Device Co., the smartphone maker spun out from Huawei Technologies Co., is developing humanoid robots as part of its push into China’s crowded artificial intelligence arena.
item.dc:creator: Vlad Savov, Jessica Sui

media:content.media:description: The Honor Device Co. pavilion at the MWC25 tech show in Barcelona, Spain.

item.title: YouTube Is Swallowing TV Whole, and It’s Coming for the Sitcom
item.description: Creators are making longer shows to meet viewers where they are: increasingly, in front of their TVs.
item.dc:creator: Lucas Shaw

media:content.media:description: Alan Chikin Chow on the set of his YouTube show Alan’s Universe in Burbank, California.

item.title: Canadian Telecom BCE to Build Large Network of AI Data Centers
item.description: BCE Inc., Canada’s largest telecom company by revenue, will set up a network of artificial intelligence data centers across the country, mirroring the aggressive AI infrastructure build-out happening in the US and abroad.
item.dc:creator: Dina Bass

media:content.media:description: A Bell store in Montreal, Quebec, Canada, on Thursday, May 8, 2025. BCE Inc. cut its dividend for the first time in 17 years and unveiled a deal with a Canadian pension fund to help finance growth in Ziply, the US broadband provider its trying to acquire.

item.title: Watchdog Probes Illegal Use of Starlink Service in South Africa
item.description: A South African regulator started a probe into allegations that Elon Musk-led SpaceX’s Starlink internet-satellite service was operating in the country illegally.
item.dc:creator: Loni Prinsloo

media:content.media:description: A Starlink Inc. satellite terminal on the rooftop of a residential building in Harare.

item.title: Zuckerberg’s Pivot Toward Trump Raises Questions About Endgame
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Riley Griffin writes about what she and colleague Kurt Wagner found in an in-depth examination of Mark Zuckerberg’s turn to the political right.
item.dc:creator: Riley Griffin

media:content.media:description: Mark Zuckerberg, chief executive officer of Meta Platforms Inc., center, arrives for the 60th presidential inauguration in the rotunda of the US Capitol in Washington, DC, US, on Monday, Jan. 20, 2025. Donald Trump's Monday swearing-in marks just the second time in US history that a president lost the office and managed to return to power - a comeback cementing his place within the Republican Party as an enduring, transformational figure rather than a one-term aberration.
